subtitle.Text: Steve: You want to talk about a place for Christmas Duck? Karla: This is where Christmas Duck goes! Steve: Oh, it's Christmas Duck's little house! Karla: It's his little house! That's where he goes, he goes into it.
Steve: There was something that I always assumed would happen, and I know that some people did do it because we got tweets on the day of release, or whatever, of people referring to this,
but, kind of based on the gnome in Half-Life 2 Episode 2 or whatever, and just a general, I think, instinct, to take the first kind of personified thing that you encounter and -
Karla: Drag it around the house with you? Steve: Yeah, try take it to the end with you, try to take it all the way there with you or whatever.
I knew that some people were going to take Christmas Duck all the way from the beginning of the game to the end of the game and that we needed to pay that off somehow.
I used the put-back system, that in almost all cases is just used to, OK, you picked up a Kleenex box and now you can put it back where you got it;
but in reality I can put one of those put-back triggers anywhere in the game that I want.
So there's one put-back trigger for Christmas Duck where you initially pick him up, and then I put another put-back trigger for Christmas Duck here.
But yeah, if you bring Christmas Duck up here, you get Katie's interaction prompt that says "There you go Christmas Duck",
and you put him back in his little nest and he gets to go back to his home at the end of the game.
